doc.field: This episode includes four sections: a brief report on a commerce forum, a feature on the visit of a Hong Kong performance troupe, a travel program, and a 13-minute Hong Kong documentary. The first section is a brief report on the U.S. Secretary of Commerce Philip Klutznick as he attends a forum organized by Chinese American commerce organization to discuss Sino-US trade relations. The second part features Hong Kong Chor Fung Ming Cantonese Opera troupe (雛鳳鳴劇團)'s operatic performing shows in the United States. Also included in this part are interviews with leading performers: Siu Chung-kwan (蕭仲坤), Lung Kim Sang (龍劍笙), Mui Suet Sze (梅雪詩), Chu Kim Tang (朱劍丹) and Yin Suet Fun (言雪芬), and with troupe manager: So Siu-Tong (蘇少棠),Wong Har-wai (黃夏蕙). The third part is program called Travelogue (遊蹤處處) in which the host introduces a skate rink in Brooklyn, New York, presumably the Abe Stark Rink of Coney Island. The fourth part shows documentary Old Man and His Painting (丁公的畫) (1977), in which Chinese painter Ting Yin Yung (丁衍庸)'s life in Hong Kong is documented.
Series III: Video Recordings >> Video 257: CCTV
